page.title: 09Agriculture (Sheep Farming)
page.content: Between the 2 estates there are approx. 3000 breeding ewes (Mostly Scottish Blackface) on hill and low ground, with between 70 and 80 rams. They are looked after by 2 shepherds with extra help at busy times. Lambing percentage on the hill is approx. 80% and on low ground approx. 150% The lambs are sold at about 6 months in the markets at Dalmally, Tarbert (Loch Fyne) or Stirling. The average price for a hill lamb in 1984 was Â£25 but around 900 ewe lambs are kept each year to join the flock. Barley and sheep cake are bought in to supplement the grazing. The price for each fleece can vary between Â£1 and Â£8 depending on its condition. This is sold to the Scottish Wool Marketing Board.
